name: DesignTokens
description: Final production design tokens: color system, typography scale, spacing, motion, elevation, and accessibility primitives. Serves as the single source of truth for all layers.
provides: Color palette with semantic aliases and theme support (light/dark/forced-colors)
Typography scale with font shorthand tokens (--h1–--h6) and fluid base sizing
Spacing, layout, and density tokens for consistent rhythm and scale
Elevation and shadow layers with dark theme adjustments
Motion and transition timing tokens with reduced-motion handling
Accessibility tokens for focus, contrast, and touch targets
Form primitives for consistent input spacing and borders

features.themeSupport: Supports light, dark, and forced-color modes via data-theme and media queries
features.semanticColorSystem: Uses neutral and brand scales mapped to semantic roles
features.fluidTypography: Implements fluid scaling between min/max type sizes
features.densityModes: Supports compact and cozy layouts via CSS custom property multipliers
features.a11yEnhancements: Tokens for focus outlines, high-contrast preference, and reduced motion
features.formSystem: Defines spacing, borders, and background tokens for form controls

a11y.contrastModes: Adjusts focus and border tokens when prefers-contrast: more
a11y.motionReduction: Disables transitions when prefers-reduced-motion is active
a11y.forcedColors: Overrides key tokens with system colors for accessibility

integrationNotes: Must be imported first in the CSS cascade.
Other layers (typography, layout, components) consume these tokens via var().
Supports runtime theming via [data-theme] and density via [data-density].
Can be extended or overridden by theme-specific token layers.

name: ThemeLayer
description: Semantic and component-level variable mappings built on top of tokens.css. Provides theme variants, color-scheme hints, and accent overrides for brand customization.
provides: Semantic variable mapping from tokens (surface, text, interactive, status)
Light and dark mode adjustments via [data-theme]
Accent theme variant for alternate brand palettes
Compact mode density modifier
Component-level aliases (buttons, inputs, cards, panels)
Color-scheme hints for user agent form control rendering

features.colorSchemeHint: Declares color-scheme: light/dark to guide UA controls and form styling.
features.themeVariants: Supports light, dark, accent, and compact themes via data attributes or classes.
features.semanticBridging: Connects low-level design tokens to higher-level component tokens.
features.brandTint: Generates tint overlays from primary RGB tokens for contextual backgrounds.

a11y.focusSystem: Aliases focus tokens from base layer to ensure visible outlines across themes.
a11y.systemIntegration: Uses color-scheme property to align browser-native UI components with theme.

integrationNotes: Must be loaded after tokens.css to ensure variable inheritance.
Acts as a semantic mapping layer consumed by component stylesheets.
Use [data-theme] or .theme-* classes to toggle theme variants at runtime.
Accent variant can be applied globally or per-component for flexible branding.

name: BaseReset
description: Normalized CSS reset and sensible defaults consuming design tokens (colors, typography, focus, motion).

dependsOn.name: tokens.css
dependsOn.description: Provides design tokens such as --bg-default, --text-default, --focus-outline, etc.

provides: HTML baseline reset
Typography and spacing scaffolding
Accessible focus and motion reduction styles
Utility classes: .visually-hidden, .clearfix, .isolate, .full-bleed

features.typography: Applies font, size, and line-height from design tokens

utilityClasses..visually-hidden: Hides content visually but keeps it accessible to screen readers
utilityClasses..isolate: Forces a new stacking context using isolation: isolate
utilityClasses..full-bleed: Expands an element to full viewport width inside centered layout

a11y.focusVisible: Uses :focus-visible and fallback for keyboard-only focus
a11y.reducedMotion: Disables transitions and animations when user prefers reduced motion
a11y.printSupport: Adds URL text to printed links for accessibility

examples: Link with token-driven hover and focus outline
integrationNotes: Load after tokens.css to ensure variables resolve correctly.
Forms inherit typography and color styles by default; apply form.css for component-level refinement.
Focus styles adapt automatically to system accessibility preferences.

name: TypographyLayer
description: Typography foundation layer consuming final design tokens for full font shorthand (h1–h6), weights, colors, and spacing rhythm. Updated to use shorthand font tokens for headings.

dependsOn.name: tokens.css
dependsOn.description: Provides typography, spacing, color, and radius tokens used throughout the layer.

dependsOn.name: base.css
dependsOn.description: Recommended to load before this layer to normalize base element styles.

provides: Heading and paragraph typography using shorthand font tokens
Link colors and transitions with brand tokens
Inline code, preformatted text, and blockquote styling
List and definition list spacing rhythm
Typography-specific utilities (alignment, truncation, display classes)

features.headingScale: Applies shorthand font tokens (h1–h6) with responsive font-size overrides
features.paragraphRhythm: Maintains consistent vertical spacing using space tokens
features.linkStates: Brand-driven colors for default, hover, and pressed states
features.codeFormatting: Inline and block code styled with mono font and background tint
features.blockquote: Soft background and left border using subtle tokens
features.listSpacing: Consistent spacing and padding for unordered/ordered/definition lists

utilityClasses..lead: Larger introductory paragraph style with increased line-height
utilityClasses..display-1: Large display heading for hero sections
utilityClasses..caption: Small, muted caption text
utilityClasses..heading-anchor: Optional inline anchor icon shown on heading hover

rules: Increases h1 and h2 size slightly above md breakpoint

a11y.printSupport: Adds link URLs after printed links; avoids breaking pre blocks
a11y.contrast: Uses tokenized text and muted colors for consistent legibility

examples: A lead paragraph introducing a section.
Brand-colored link with tokenized hover and focus states
Design is not just what it looks like.
integrationNotes: Load after tokens.css and base.css for correct variable resolution.
Uses shorthand font tokens (--h1–--h6) for headings to ensure consistency across themes.
Typography utilities (.lead, .truncate, .caption) can be used within components.
Responsive adjustments scale h1/h2 sizes at the md breakpoint.

name: LayoutLayer
description: Layout foundation providing containers, responsive flex/grid systems, spacing stacks, wrappers, and alignment utilities using design tokens.

dependsOn.name: tokens.css
dependsOn.description: Provides breakpoint, spacing, gutter, radius, and elevation tokens.

dependsOn.name: base.css
dependsOn.description: Optional: ensures consistent box sizing and element defaults.

provides: Centered container system with responsive max-widths
12-column flexbox grid with breakpoint variants (.sm, .md, .lg)
CSS grid helpers (auto-fit/fill and fixed column counts)
Stack and inline-stack utilities with gap control
Panels and wrappers with elevation, radius, and spacing tokens
Alignment and justification helpers for layout composition
Overflow, containment, and motion-safe behaviors

features.containers: Fluid and fixed-width containers with responsive breakpoints
features.gridSystem: 12-column flex grid with .col-1–12 span classes and responsive prefixes (.sm, .md, .lg)
features.spacing: Stack and inline-stack utilities using tokenized gap values
features.cardsAndWrappers: Tokenized wrapper and card components with radius, background, and shadow
features.alignment: Flex alignment utilities for vertical and horizontal placement
features.overflowContainment: Utility helpers for managing overflow and containment contexts

utilityClasses..container: Centered max-width container with horizontal padding
utilityClasses..container-fluid: Full-width container with no side padding
utilityClasses..row: Flex container for grid columns with negative gutter margins
utilityClasses..col: Column cell that flexes equally within a .row
utilityClasses..grid: Display grid with token-based gap spacing
utilityClasses..grid-auto-fit: Responsive grid filling available space automatically
utilityClasses..stack: Vertical layout stack with customizable gap
utilityClasses..inline-stack: Horizontal stack for inline elements with gap control
utilityClasses..wrapper: Tokenized padded panel with background and rounded corners
utilityClasses..card: Elevated container with optional header, body, and footer sections
utilityClasses..sticky-top: Sticky header helper with z-index and inherited background
utilityClasses..justify-*: Justify-content utilities (start, center, end, between, around)

rules: .container resizes at sm/md/xl breakpoints using max-width tokens

a11y.reducedMotion: Removes sticky positioning when motion reduction is preferred
a11y.printSupport: Adds padding and avoids page-breaks inside rows during print

integrationNotes: Load after tokens.css to ensure gutter, space, and radius variables resolve.
Works with BaseReset and TypographyLayer to form the global foundation.
Grid system is flex-based for predictable wrapping; CSS grid helpers can be combined as needed.
Reduced motion mode adjusts sticky behavior for accessibility.
Card and wrapper components use elevation and color tokens for consistent theme alignment.

name: UtilitiesLayer
description: Atomic utility classes for spacing, display, flex alignment, text formatting, sizing, borders, shadows, positioning, and accessibility, built from final design tokens.

dependsOn.name: tokens.css
dependsOn.description: Provides design tokens for spacing, color, typography, border, radius, and elevation.

dependsOn.name: base.css
dependsOn.description: Optional base reset ensuring consistent rendering across browsers.

provides: Margin and padding utilities using --space-* tokens
Display and responsive visibility helpers
Flexbox and alignment shortcuts for layout composition
Text alignment, transformation, color, and weight utilities
Sizing, width, height, and fit-content helpers
Borders, radius, and elevation (shadow) utilities
Positioning, z-index, overflow, and visibility management
Cursor and interaction helpers
Accessibility utilities (sr-only, focus-ring)
Responsive typography and motion-safe defaults

features.spacing: Token-based margin/padding utilities with directional variants
features.display: Block, inline, flex, grid, and responsive visibility classes
features.flexAlignment: Atomic flex-direction, wrap, gap, and align/justify helpers
features.typography: Text alignment, transformation, color, and responsive sizing
features.borders: Border visibility, color, and radius utilities with design tokens
features.positioning: Static, relative, absolute, fixed, and sticky positioning helpers

a11y.focusManagement: Adds consistent token-based focus outline via .focus-ring
a11y.screenReaderSupport: Hides content visually while preserving screen reader access via .sr-only
a11y.reducedMotion: Globally disables transitions and animations when user prefers reduced motion

examples: Box with padding and shadow
integrationNotes: Intended to load after Base, Typography, and Layout layers.
Utility classes can override component styles using !important for atomic overrides.
Tokens drive all spacing, color, radius, and elevation values for consistency.
Reduced motion support globally disables animations and transitions when system preferences are set.

description: Component layer defining UI primitives such as buttons, forms, cards, alerts, modals, toasts, and other interactive elements. References final design tokens for color, spacing, radius, typography, and elevation.

name: AnimationLayer
description: Centralized keyframes, animation utilities, and transition helpers, respecting prefers-reduced-motion and tokenized durations from tokens.css.
provides: Keyframe definitions for common UI transitions (fade, slide, pop, spin, shimmer)
Composable animation utility classes for quick application
Transition helpers for opacity, transform, and default UI transitions
Motion-safe and reduced-motion-aware behavior via media queries and helper classes
Speed modifiers via semantic duration tokens (--dur-quick, --dur-medium, --dur-long)

features.motionSafe: Applies animations only when system prefers motion is allowed.
features.reducedMotion: Automatically disables animations/transitions for users preferring reduced motion.
features.speedModifiers: Semantic classes to adjust animation speed without modifying keyframes.
features.keyframeLibrary: Provides reusable keyframes for common UI patterns (fade, slide, pop, spin, shimmer).
features.transitionHelpers: Utility classes for smooth opacity and transform transitions.

a11y.reducedMotionSupport: Honors user OS-level preference for reduced motion.
a11y.focusIntegration: Combines with motion-safe toggles to avoid interfering with focus outlines or interactive feedback.

integrationNotes: Load after tokens.css to ensure duration and easing variables are available.
Use utility classes directly in markup or compose with JS-driven toggles.
Motion-safe and reduced-motion classes enable progressive enhancement.
Animation and transition classes can be combined with theme.css or component stylesheets.
